item.title: Alleged pediatric dental malpractice lands Houston dentist in police custody
item.description: Houston’s ABC Channel 13 recently reported that Houston dentist Bethaniel Jefferson, DDS was indicted and in custody on the charge of “intentionally and knowingly by omission” causing serious bodily injury to a child by failing to seek and provide adequate medical attention. It is shocking that a four-year-old little girl ended up with severe brain damage in what started as a visit to have a tooth pulled. Her family filed dental malpractice suit was filed in July 2016, and the 281st District Court, where Judge Sylvia Matthews presides.
